availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert Enders (Paducah, Kentucky, retired merchant and planter)

body.p: Paducah, Kentucky, retired merchant and planter. Virginia native. Married to Amanda Bradford Enders in 1826. Father of Malvina Enders, Amanda Enders, Jacob A. Enders, and Lucy J. Enders. Married to Harriet L. Enders. Father of Amanda Enders. Merchant in Paducah in 1850. Retired merchant in Paducah in 1860. Owned twenty-two enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, District 1, p. 141. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, District 2, Paducah, p. 110. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, District 2, Paducah, p. 16. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, Precinct 6, p. 33. Genealogies of Virginia Families, From Tyler’s Quarterly Historical and Genealogical Magazine, Volume I: Albridgton-Gerlache (Baltimore, MD: Genealogical Publishing Co for Clearfield Company, 2007), p. 193-195.
